body_html:
Hi Anagha! Congrats with your first PR in the teams app! Thanks!
Before your PR is ready for review, the merge conflict should be solved.

It looks like the master branch of your own fork was not in sync with the upstream master. (GitHub tells you so when it say that your master branch is 'x commits' behind .

I would suggest: save the changes you made yourself in a separate branch (not master). On your computer.
Then, get the changes from upstream in your computer : git pull upstream master
Then, get your fork (on GitHub) in sync by pushing the recent changes: git push origin master
And only then, push the changes of your new branch to your own fork: git push origin <your_local_branch>
After that, you should be able to open a PR in upstream, and compare it with your own fork. And there should not be a merge conflict.
Let me know if you need help or if you have questions.

(@carpmeister ping)

body: Hi Anagha! Congrats with your first PR in the teams app! Thanks! Before your PR is ready for review, the merge conflict should be solved. It looks like the master branch of your own fork was not in sync with the upstream master. (GitHub tells you so when it say that your master branch is 'x commits' behind . I would suggest: save the changes you made yourself in a separate branch (not master). On your computer. Then, get the changes from upstream in your computer : `git pull upstream master` Then, get your fork (on GitHub) in sync by pushing the recent changes: ` git push origin master` And only then, push the changes of your new branch to your own fork: `git push origin ` After that, you should be able to open a PR in upstream, and compare it with your own fork. And there should not be a merge conflict. Let me know if you need help or if you have questions. (@carpmeister ping)
